intro: Rosa glauca f. dorrii, commonly known as the Dorrii rose, is a botanical variant of the glaucous rose. It is characterized by its pale blue to white flowers and fuzzy, bluish-green foliage. This form is typically found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. The plant is a shrub with thorny stems and is native to regions in the western United States. Its horticultural value lies in its unique coloration and adaptability to challenging growing conditions.
